doc.after: Macmillan gave a speech in Cape Town, South Africa in February 1960 where he spoke of "the wind of change blowing through this continent."[198] Macmillan wished to avoid the same kind of colonial war that France was fighting in Algeria, and under his premiership decolonisation proceeded rapidly.[199] To the three colonies that had been granted independence in the 1950sâSudan, the Gold Coast and Malayaâwere added nearly ten times that number during the 1960s.[200]
